This event has been a part of Fort Worth history since 1896. The Fort Worth Stock Show & Rodeo is the biggest livestock sale barn in the US. Ranchers from all over the country make their way to Fort Worth each year for 3 weeks of live auctions, FFA competitions, and the infamous Rodeo.
This place is home to the world\'s only twice-daily cattle drive.
With it\'s history dating back to 1866, this western themed entertainment district is the #1 tourist destination in Fort Worth.

It\'s history dates back to 1866 with the early cattle trade. The booming cattle industry gave way to Fort Worth\'s nickname, Cowtown! The Stockyards is a western themed entertainment district is the #1 tourist destination in Fort Worth.
